repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - BOS-KITA Capacity Development
            and Campaign Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings summary of the BOS-KITA
            Capacity Development and Campaign project in Indonesia are
            as follows:  Outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible, bank performance was
            satisfactory and grantee performance was satisfactory.  No
            significant changes or revisions were made to the project.
            Some lessons learned include the knowledge that significant
            delays occur with fund distribution due to the time required
            to formalize GoI and donor agreements, also, that capacity
            building and reaching agreement with various levels of
            government is time-consuming and impacted by delayed fund
            release into provincial DIPAs.  Additional lessons learned
            were that training methodology needs to cater for diverse
            participant needs and provide opportunities for activities
            and participant discussions that address practical
            challenges in BOS management faced by schools and that the
            role and responsibilities of local governments with regard
            to financing and managing the BOS program are expected to
            increase indicating the need for structured training at
            District and possibly Sub- District levels. Also learned was
            the empowerment of parents, the community and the oversight
            of the SC emphasizes the need to build Principal/Head
            Teacher leadership and management capacity to respond
            effectively to the financial, political and interpersonal
            challenges of BOS.
